intro: Corispermum emarginatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It is a small annual herb with erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has succulent leaves that help it retain water in dry environments, and its seeds are encased in a hard, spiny capsule. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Corispermum emarginatum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
